resources.string: Close editor and open floating window
Overlay permission is required to show the floating window.

" Floating Prompter User Guide: 1. Enter your desired prompter content on the main screen. 2. Click the button at the bottom to open the floating window. 3. In the upper part of the floating window, you can drag to scroll the prompter. 4. In the control panel in the lower part of the floating window, you can adjust the scrolling speed and font size. 5. Click the "Play/Pause" button to control scrolling, click "Edit" to return to the main screen, and click "Close" to exit the application.
Test Content: This is a floating prompter application used to provide prompts during speeches or readings. You can enter text through the main interface and then open the floating window for display. The upper part of the floating window displays the prompts and supports dragging to adjust the scrolling position. The lower part of the floating window is the control panel, where you can adjust the scrolling speed, font size, and control play, pause, edit, and close. This application is suitable for scenarios that require prompting, such as speeches, live broadcasts, recitations, etc. "
